metadata.name: Probability Presets Explorer
metadata.author: Card Game Engine
metadata.description: Explore 12+ pre-configured probability scenarios with one click. Perfect for 7th-grade students learning probability concepts through hands-on experiments.

cards.note: Different presets use different deck configurations. Some presets include jokers.

instructions.overview: Explore common probability scenarios with pre-configured experiments. Each preset automatically sets up the experiment for you - just click and start flipping cards!
setup: Browse the preset cards on the left side
Each preset shows its difficulty level (Easy, Medium, Hard)
Click any preset card to load that experiment
Read the description and 'Why This Matters' sections
Look at the example cards to see what you're looking for
gameplay: Click 'Flip 1 Card' to draw one card at a time
Click 'Flip 10 Cards' to quickly run 10 trials
Click 'Flip 50 Cards' to run a larger experiment
Watch your results update in real-time
Compare your experimental results to the theoretical probability
Click 'Reset' to start the experiment over
Try different presets to explore various probability concepts
instructions.winning: Learn by exploring! Success means understanding how experimental results approach theoretical predictions. The more cards you flip, the closer you get to the expected probability!

examples.title: Even vs Odd

visualResults.accuracy: Encouraging messages based on how close you are

educational.whyItMatters: Each preset explains why the concept is important

educational.exampleCards: Visual examples of what to look for
